attributes.action: Remove MP for Lanark & Hamilton East from the backbenches
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Help make Clydesdale's MPs more transparent and 'honorable'.

Petition to have the current Lanark and Hamilton East MP stand down before next general election. If the current MP is allowed to remain as an MP till the next General Election (within a year) then he'll automatically receive a huge pension paid by the taxpayer. How can this be justified when this MP has claimed a total of £115,227 between 2001 and 2007 as additional cost allowance. He has also claimed:

* £400 per month for food, the maximum allowed without receipts, over 11 months in 2004-05.

* £200 for food in August, 2004, when the Commons was in recess.

* Between £445.14 and £728.68 for mortgage interest on his designated second home.

* £1500 for furniture.

* £1400 for carpets.

* Over £1000 for electrical goods including £489.95 for a 26-inch LCD television.

More details can be found on the Hamilton Advertiser newspaper article of 28 May 2009 entitled "MP claimed £1000 a month and didn’t have to submit receipts".

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament: http://www.parliament.uk/ or with the relevant political party.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
